ticket.title: View rendering 9x slower than Rails 2.2.2
ticket.original-body:
(In case the formatting fails here, a pleasant-to-look at version is at http://pastie.org/private/ervcyl7forqnvcfbzs9w )
Despite the output logs being just about the exact same, Rails 2.3 RC1 is reporting as significantly slower than Rails 2.2.2 in development mode for my app. There is no visible reason for the slowdown in the logs, but the View rendering for 2.3 reports in as 9x slower than the View rendering in 2.2.2
These results are consistent across multiple page reloads.
@@@ Rails 2.3 RC1 Rails 2.2.2
Processing NodesController#blips (for 192 Processing NodesController#blips (for 192 Session ID: 41d43b6eb404659a1b7cf8b1627 Parameters: {"action"=>"blips", "contro Parameters: {"action"=>"blips", ticket.latest-body:
(In case the formatting fails here, a pleasant-to-look at version is at http://pastie.org/private/ervcyl7forqnvcfbzs9w )
Despite the output logs being just about the exact same, Rails 2.3 RC1 is reporting as significantly slower than Rails 2.2.2 in development mode for my app. There is no visible reason for the slowdown in the logs, but the View rendering for 2.3 reports in as 9x slower than the View rendering in 2.2.2
These results are consistent across multiple page reloads.

ticket.original-body-html:
(In case the formatting fails here, a pleasant-to-look at version is at http://pastie.org/private/ervcyl... )

Despite the output logs being just about the exact same, Rails 2.3 RC1 is reporting as significantly slower than Rails 2.2.2 in development mode for my app. There is no visible reason for the slowdown in the logs, but the View rendering for 2.3 reports in as 9x slower than the View rendering in 2.2.2

These results are consistent across multiple page reloads.


Rails 2.3 RC1                                       Rails 2.2.2				
                                                    
Processing NodesController#blips (for 192           Processing NodesController#blips (for 192

version.body:
(In case the formatting fails here, a pleasant-to-look at version is at http://pastie.org/private/ervcyl7forqnvcfbzs9w )
Despite the output logs being just about the exact same, Rails 2.3 RC1 is reporting as significantly slower than Rails 2.2.2 in development mode for my app. There is no visible reason for the slowdown in the logs, but the View rendering for 2.3 reports in as 9x slower than the View rendering in 2.2.2
These results are consistent across multiple page reloads.

version.body-html:
(In case the formatting fails here, a pleasant-to-look at version is at http://pastie.org/private/ervcyl... )

Despite the output logs being just about the exact same, Rails 2.3 RC1 is reporting as significantly slower than Rails 2.2.2 in development mode for my app. There is no visible reason for the slowdown in the logs, but the View rendering for 2.3 reports in as 9x slower than the View rendering in 2.2.2

These results are consistent across multiple page reloads.

version.title: View rendering 9x slower than Rails 2.2.2

version.body: Oh, I guess I should add that via the very scientific stopwatch test, Rails 2.3 is actually rendering more slowly - that is, this isn't solely an issue with the reporting.
version.body-html: Oh, I guess I should add that via the very scientific stopwatch test, Rails 2.3 is actually rendering more slowly - that is, this isn't solely an issue with the reporting.
version.title: View rendering 9x slower than Rails 2.2.2

version.body: Does my latest patch in #1909 help?
version.body-html: Does my latest patch in #1909 help?
version.title: View rendering 9x slower than Rails 2.2.2

version.body: Yup, that's the magic sauce. My view render time is back down to ~115ms on Rails 2.3, and the page render time is down accordingly. I'll add a note to your ticket.
version.body-html: Yup, that's the magic sauce. My view render time is back down to ~115ms on Rails 2.3, and the page render time is down accordingly. I'll add a note to your ticket.
